label: Max HR (Zone 2)
short_description: Training dictated by specific beats-per-minute ranges to target aerobic or anaerobic thresholds.

label: Intervals
short_description: Repeated bouts of high-intensity effort followed by varied recovery periods of lower intensity.

label: Low-Impact
short_description: Aerobic activity designed to minimize mechanical stress on bones and joints (e.g., swimming, cycling).

label: Sprint
short_description: Short, explosive bursts of maximum speed intended to improve anaerobic power and top-end velocity.

label: Steady-State
short_description: Continuous, moderate-intensity activity maintained at a consistent pace for an extended duration.

label: Tempo/Threshold
short_description: High-intensity "comfortably hard" pace sustained to improve the body's ability to clear lactic acid.

label: Other
short_description: Cardiovascular activities that do not follow standard intensity or duration protocols.
